thread.title: Great Things in Great Falls: Escape the cold at the hottest upcoming events! | Great Falls News
thread.title_full: Great Things in Great Falls: Escape the cold at the hottest upcoming events! | Great Falls News | montanarightnow.com

author: Bradley Warren Morning Anchor Author facebook
title: Great Things in Great Falls: Escape the cold at the hottest upcoming events! | Great Falls News
text:
Great Falls, Montana - As winter surrounds Great Falls, Montana, residents and visitors alike still have a variety of exciting events to look forward to that will warm their hearts: ranging from free admission at the Lewis and Clark Interpretive Center to the conclusion of the PRCA Rodeo.
Free Admission at Lewis and Clark Interpretive Center Escape the cold and dive into the rich history of Montana at the Lewis and Clark Interpretive Center! For the months of January and February, residents and visitors can enjoy free admission as a token of gratitude from the center. Whether you're a history buff or just looking for an indoor escape, this opportunity is not to be missed.
CM Russell Museum Additionally, the CM Russell Museum also is offering free admission for the second Saturday of the month starting today, Jan 13, until April, providing another cultural gem for exploration.
PRCA Rodeo's Grand Finale: Cowboys and Rodeo Action Saddle up and embrace your inner cowboy as the PRCA Rodeo concludes its thrilling circuit finals. The last night of the rodeo tonight, Jan 13, promises an exhilarating showcase. So, don your cowboy hat, leave the winter chill behind, and witness the spectacle unfold indoors.
Jackson Dean at the Newberry: A Country Music Extravaganza Country music enthusiasts, Jackson Dean takes the stage at the Newberry on Thurs, Jan 18. Get ready for a night of the old-school gritty style of country music as the 23-year-old up-and-coming musician takes the stage.
MAGIE: Celebrating Agriculture Innovation For those intrigued by the latest in agriculture technology here in the heart of the Golden Triangle, MAGIE is the event for you!
The event showcases cutting-edge machinery, science, and innovations in crop production, MAGIE brings together industry professionals and curious onlookers. Gain insights into Montana's agricultural progress and witness the scale of machinery that drives the state's economy.
MAGIE will be happening Jan 17, 18, & 19 at the Four Seasons Arena & Exhibition Hall.
Winter Trail Days: Embrace the Outdoors with Guided Hikes and Hot Cocoa Looking ahead to warmer days, mark your calendar for Winter Trail Days on February 3rd. Organized by Get Fit Great Falls, this event offers guided hikes and even snowshoeing experiences. If you're a new outdoorsman and the wilderness intimidates you - Fear not! You can join guided hikes and explore the beauty of the outdoors. And to cap it off, indulge in hot cocoa around a welcoming bonfire.
